_header: Love that is poor it is with pine
_description: What Love is — four couplets (with ‘Love’ anaphora)

PierpontAcc775.First Lines:
Love þat is powre it is with pynelove that is riche it is ethe
                    forto tyn…
PierpontAcc775.Last Lines:
…love that is false it will a wayelove that is trwe it
                    lastythe aye
PierpontAcc775.Note:
Added by a hand of the sixteenth century to the Morgan copy of 
            Boethius, Boecius de consolacione philosophie, [Westminster: Printed by William
            Caxton, 1478]  (ChL 1766a).
PierpontAcc775.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “Libri Impressi cum notis Manuscriptis, Part I.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         53 (1938): 245-49: 246.

Banna.First Lines:
Luve þat is het can no skillLuve þat is cald can be
                    stillLuve þat is peure wat mekle pyneLuve þat is riche Is
                    eith to tyne…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Luve þat is trew Lestis ayLuve þat is fals wenttis
                    away
Banna.Facsimiles:
Fox,  Denton,  and  William A. Ringler.  
             The Bannatyne Manuscript: National Library of Scotland Advocates’
                MS. 1.1.6
         London: Scolar Press, in Association with The National Library of
            Scotland, 1980.
Banna.Editions:
Murdoch,  James Barclay. 
             The Bannatyne Manuscript.
             4 vols. in 11 parts, paged continuously. 
             Hunterian Club
         16, 32, 40, 46, 50, 55-56, 64-67 Glasgow: Anderson, 1873-1896: 4.733.
Ritchie,  W. Tod,
                        ed.  
             The Bannatyne Manuscript.
             4 parts in 4 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         3rd ser. 5 (1928); n.s. 22 (1928); n.s. 23 (1930); n.s. 26 (1934)
            Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1928-34; ed. by Ritchie et al: 4.40.
